channel.title: Would this be mean?
channel.description: So a girl is sitting in subway, her and her friend are eating and she calls her work and says "I'm going to be late had to go get formula for my baby". Then after hanging up told her friend it is so easy to be late for work. So I leave and call her work *Wendy's* and tell them what she was really doing and said when I returned she was on the phone very upset telling her friend she doesn't work now ._.

I’m my own boss

item.title: Would this be mean?
item.dc:creator: @TabbyKiller TabbyKiller
item.description:
@TabbyKiller wrote:

She has obviously lied more than once if she says how easy it was. Someone who isn’t dedicated to working somewhere that requires it and has to lie to get off, doesn’t deserve to work there at all. Enough of this 12 year old snitches get stitches crap, if you want to make a living, earn it. If you want a day off with a friend, earn it. Honesty is the best policy.

Read full topic

item.title: Would this be mean?
item.dc:creator: @krackkid Krackkid
item.description:
@krackkid wrote:

[quote=“Kidpaparoach, post:38, topic:542923”]It depends on your view on the matter. Yes, she was in the wrong and you technically were a good citizen. But everyone slacks of (to an extent) from time to time.

Just from my stand point I think you were being a douche but as I said you were technically not in the wrong but realistically regardless of what she did, it does seem like she cared about that job. I think wendy’s is a fast food place (?) so I can’t blame her for not wanting to go back to work when she was enjoying spending time with a friend.

I know this is fairly silly thing to say but in regards to things like this (assuming they aren’t major), mind your own business. You don’t know other peoples, you don’t know the negative impact you can cause by doing things like that.[/quote]I guess I understand whst youre saying here but at the same time she was talking about dropping various product (food, ice, and napkins) and still serving them to customers think of the negative impact on health that could happen from that. Yeah I dont know her situation I think she was more upset because she was caught in a lie more then anything but as David stated if they did fire her from just what I said she clearly has had to have done more stuff then just this.

Again I dont know if she got fired or not.

Read full topic

item.title: Would this be mean?
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“Kidpaparoach, post:38, topic:542923”]It depends on your view on the matter. Yes, she was in the wrong and you technically were a good citizen. But everyone slacks of (to an extent) from time to time.

Just from my stand point I think you were being a douche but as I said you were technically not in the wrong but realistically regardless of what she did, it does seem like she cared about that job. I think wendy’s is a fast food place (?) so I can’t blame her for not wanting to go back to work when she was enjoying spending time with a friend.

I know this is fairly silly thing to say but in regards to things like this (assuming they aren’t major), mind your own business. You don’t know other peoples, you don’t know the negative impact you can cause by doing things like that.[/quote]I can agree with most of this post. The only thing I would add is that a job like Wendy’s (or any fast food place) is a good place to be to make mistakes. If you learn to have a bad worth ethic at a starter job it’s going to haunt you later. Better to learn now. Also important to note that it’s not krackkid’s fault she got caught, if she has a tendency to lie and goof off she will get caught anyway eventually. And if she did get fired I will assume she has been caught before.

Read full topic

item.title: Would this be mean?
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

It depends on your view on the matter. Yes, she was in the wrong and you technically were a good citizen. But everyone slacks of (to an extent) from time to time.

Just from my stand point I think you were being a douche but as I said you were technically not in the wrong but realistically regardless of what she did, it does seem like she cared about that job. I think wendy’s is a fast food place (?) so I can’t blame her for not wanting to go back to work when she was enjoying spending time with a friend.

I know this is fairly silly thing to say but in regards to things like this (assuming they aren’t major), mind your own business. You don’t know other peoples, you don’t know the negative impact you can cause by doing things like that.

Read full topic

item.title: Would this be mean?
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“Ambokile, post:36, topic:542923”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=661800.msg4423654#msg4423654 date=1399663310][quote author=Bowser jr link=topic=661800.msg4423641#msg4423641 date=1399656289]
Or she is struggling too much with her child and needs a break.
[/quote]So seems soooooo stressed. Laughing and bragging to a friend about lying to her boss to get out of work. Protip: if you have a child, just tell the truth and tell your boss you need a break.
[/quote]

Fast food bosses are, after all, known for how reasonable they are! After all, it’s not like they punish workers solely based on a phone call from a complete stranger, is it?[/quote]I too can take extreme examples and use them to justify making poor choices. The boss was okay with her being late to pick up baby formula, he seems like a real dick. He was being nice to her because of her situation and she takes advantage of it? Yea, this is definitely an unreasonable boss, not an unreasonable employee.

Read full topic

item.title: Would this be mean?

item.description:

Or she is struggling too much with her child and needs a break.
[/quote]So seems soooooo stressed. Laughing and bragging to a friend about lying to her boss to get out of work. Protip: if you have a child, just tell the truth and tell your boss you need a break.[/quote]

Fast food bosses are, after all, known for how reasonable they are! After all, it’s not like they punish workers solely based on a phone call from a complete stranger, is it?

Read full topic

item.title: Would this be mean?
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“Ashi, post:25, topic:542923”]Maybe you don’t know the stress of having a child. Everybody derserves a break, for all we know the girl could have just been 15 mins late.[/quote][quote=“Bowser jr, post:30, topic:542923”]Or she is struggling too much with her child and needs a break.[/quote]So seems soooooo stressed. Laughing and bragging to a friend about lying to her boss to get out of work. Protip: if you have a child, just tell the truth and tell your boss you need a break.

[quote=“Ambokile, post:23, topic:542923”]So users talk about Darwinism, moderators talk about enforcing removal of children due to parents work ethics… but any discussion of the Nazis results in a +30 (moderation?)

No, sir, the moderators are perfect with their discretion. It definitely keeps the site fair.[/quote]Lol, do you even know what you are talking about? How are any of those things even slightly comparable? And secondly, we allowed the discussion of nazism to stay without people getting infracted. Unless you are talking about the happy birthday thread that was just celebrating Hitler and not actually having any discussion, which got deleted. And the poster had a moderation for 1 day and then it got removed.

Read full topic

That think this kind of behavior should be accept, was it my place i would say sort of I have ate there before and saying she has served food that has hit the floor is kind of ridiculous.

item.title: Would this be mean?
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:

[quote=“Krackkid, post:31, topic:542923”]@James frpm the way she was talking with her friend saying various things such as dropping food and still selling it abd laughing that people dont realize it waa on the floor and saying she calls in late all the time she clearly wasn’t taking the job seriously. How does that make it bad that I helped her either lose the job or at least draw to the management’s attention that this employee is abusing their trust?

@bowser I highly doubt she’s struggling she seemed like the kind of mother to dump their kid at theur parents and go clubbing. But thats just personal judgement[/quote]
You’re a douche bag for snitching. The worst thing is that she lost her job and not get given a warning or anything.

item.title: Would this be mean?
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

OP: This means that you’re an asshole.

[quote=“Davidi2, post:22, topic:542923”][quote author=Ashi link=topic=661800.msg4423557#msg4423557 date=1399589231]

Nobody likes a snitch.
Nobody likes people who don’t mind their own business.

What’s there to say about the scenario?

Nobody likes liars.
Nobody likes people who don’t work for their pay check.

What’s there to say about the girl?

If you find it that you must make up ridiculous lies to get out of work, maybe a new job is in question?

Maybe she’s getting paid for the hours she works. So she wouldn’t get paid if she didn’t turn up however she had to tell a lie so that there would be somebody to cover her shift while she was “busy”?

So you got her fired. She must have a kid ofc, otherwise her employer wouldn’t have believed her. Now she can’t afford to support her baby since she lost her job. Baby gets taken. Life gets ruined. Life’s over.

I’m just messing about, but I rather lie then snitch
[/quote]If she has a kid and she is taking advantage of that to goof around instead of working to help support her child, why exactly should she be able to keep it anyways?[/quote]
Or she is struggling too much with her child and needs a break.

Read full topic

item.title: Would this be mean?
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

[quote=“Krackkid, post:28, topic:542923”][quote author=Ambokile link=topic=661800.msg4423636#msg4423636 date=1399652112]

From what I over heard the shift was at 4:30 and she left around 5:00. I do know the stress of having a child around and I made sure I was never late too.

heyyyyyy guysss want to know if this is meaaaaannnn

loollll no its not meaaannn why are you even suggestingg thatttt

it wassntt meaaaan here’s a list of reasons whyyyy but pleaaase tell me if you think it was mean

like my status if u think so xx
[/quote]I liked you better when you were banned, less childish. But i want different opinions on this subject why be an ass and spam? Either reply with your opinion or dont simple.[/quote]

My opinion is that this entire topic is you being an attention seeking brat, like most of your other posts of late. My opinion, like many others, is that you went out of your way to negatively affect the life of someone you didn’t know. Who on earth are you to judge whether or not they “deserve” their job? For all you know, they’ve worked late the past 5 nights and took a day off to finally get some rest. It is not your place to do that to someone else. Of course, you know that, otherwise you wouldn’t have posted this topic.

Read full topic
